text: hello this is Bill Cunningham and it is
the beginning of new york fashion week
and the showings of designers for next
autumn and next winter and I thought as
I looked around New York after the
holidays look at the way people
addressed it looks like them they were
all going to a major funeral well no one
has died it's just New Yorkers doing
what they do best and that is wearing
all black so they all look like 19th
century silhouettes I think it's
terrific and as Fashion Week opens it
also brings a mystery to what might
happen with the say 200 designers that
will have formal shows there might be
three hundred more that have showroom
presentations but it is the mystery of
what might come out of these shows what
is fashion for today where is it going
how a modern women going to dress are
they going to be decorative are they
going to be minimal it presents so many
different facets to dressing women many
minds the idea of fashion itself is out
of fashion this is what at the moment I
think the streets reflected in all of
this silhouette black so perfectly the
major question what is going to happen
to fashion so that is my opening
thoughts as we look at fashion on the
street for the opening of the Fashion
Week in New York
